abstract: A financial aid expert takes the measure of a presidential proposal to ease the repayment of student loans -- at least to new borrowers.
snippet: A financial aid expert takes the measure of a presidential proposal to ease the repayment of student loans -- at least to new borrowers.
lead_paragraph: Blogger's Note: Tamar Lewin writes on The Times's Web site on Wednesday that President Obama will announce new programs "to lower monthly loan payments for some students graduating next year and thereafter and to let borrowers who have a mix of direct federal loans and loans under the old Federal Family Education Loan Program consolidate them at a slightly lower interest rate.'' Mark Kantrowitz, the publisher of the financial aid Web sites finaid.org and fastweb, was asked by The Choice to write a quick essay explaining what the proposal might mean for applicants this year, and in the future, for current students and recent graduates. -- Jacques Steinberg

headline.main: The Student Loan Proposal: What It Might Mean for You
